result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory Leigh Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety
Provide DNA sample
Comply with any programming imposed by agent
Agent to look at Restorative Justice process with Defendant and Victim, order if necessary.
Agent to look at helping Defendant obtain his DL.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay previously order restitution and court costs.

03:08 PM Defendant Cory Leigh Riley in court, in custody. Atty Liesl Nelson in court with the defendant. Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Walker: 18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, victim is present in the case no restitution paid yet on this case, defendant has been in custody on hold since September 7, 2018 no objection to 98 days credit for that time, requests $18758.56 in restitution be held over a paid during extended supervision,$342.00 civil judgment. Victim addresses the court.  Atty Nelson, defendant has sat 13 months, requests incarceration for approx the time he has served now, 396 days credit--Walker agrees. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders: 3 1/2 years in the Wisconsin Prision System, 18 months initial confinement, 2 years Extended Supervision-- conditions of ES, payment of $18758.56 in restitution, credit for 396 days, court orders civil judgment be entered for $342.00. Appeal Rights are given to the defendant. 03:35
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 29, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

1:06 Defendant Cory Leigh Riley in court, in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant thought he had an attorney from prior hearing. Court: reset this matter so the Def can obtain legal counsel.1:07
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 27, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
from Probation Agent asking for 18 months confinement followed by 2 years ES.

records.addlTxt: 11:28 Defendant Cory Leigh Riley in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie and Helgeson have both reviewed the PSI provided by the DOC. No changes or corrections.  Thorie: 3 years probation with 10 month conditional jail time. No contact with Roger Anderson and his home residence.  Restitution of $18,758.56. Maintain absolute soberity. DNA sample and Surcharge. court costs. Roger Anderson speaks to the court.  Atty Helgeson argues sentencing; requests some house arrest. Def addresses the Court. Court: S/W 3 years probation. conditions: No contact with Roger Anderson or his home residence (317 Sherwood Forest, River Falls WI 54022). Restitution TBT in 30 days (amount of $18,758.56). Maintain absolute soberity. Court costs, DNA sample and surchage. Any specific programming imposed by Agent. 10 months in the county jail to immediatley ; huber is allowed. No home monitoring. Jail rules govern. Asks agent to look at Restorative Justice process with Def and Victim; if the agent thinks it would be helpful, order it. Agent to look at helping Def get his DL.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

10:09 Defendant Cory Leigh Riley in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files amended information. guilty to charge contained in the amended information. Requests PSI. Helgeson and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge contained in amended information; Helgeson stipulates to factual basis for conviction.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to charge contained  in amended information. Orders a PSI. Set this matter for sentencing. Def to remain until he is handed a notice.
